thread.title: Ground News - Flooding in Shropshire: Stay vigilant warning as river levels rise
thread.title_full: Ground News - Flooding in Shropshire: Stay vigilant warning as river levels rise

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Flooding in Shropshire: Stay vigilant warning as river levels rise
text:
Summary by Ground News Three flood warnings have been issued across Shropshire as river levels continue to rise. Warnings are in place for the River Severn at the Showground and The Quarry in Shrewsbury, and the River Vyrnwy at Maesbrook and Melverley. Environment Agency has also said a flood warning is likely for Bridgnorth. Share menu More
Filters 2 Articles 2 Articles All Left Center Right
BBC News Center High Factuality Government: Government of the United Kingdom Flooding in Shropshire: Stay vigilant warning as river levels rise Levels on the Severn are peaking in Shrewsbury, but still rising around Ironbridge and Bridgnorth.
2 hours ago · United Kingdom Read Full Article
BBC News Center High Factuality Government: Government of the United Kingdom
Flooding in Shropshire: Stay vigilant warning as river levels rise Levels on the Severn are peaking in Shrewsbury, but still rising around Ironbridge and Bridgnorth.
2 hours ago · United Kingdom Read Full Article Shropshire Star Media Conglomerate: MNA Media Shropshire river levels expected to peak today after Storm Gerrit battering Flood defences were put up in Shrewsbury and Ironbridge earlier this week as the Environment Agency prepared for the impact of the swollen River Severn. A flood warning issued for Shrewsbury on Thursday afternoon said that flooding of property, roads and farmland is "expected" and that the river is likely to peak at the Welsh Bridge on Friday evening.
11 hours ago · Ketley, United Kingdom Read Full Article
